- **Founder and leadership**
  - **Linda Speldewinde** — Founder and Chairperson of **AOD**; drives bridging local heritage with international design education; founder of **Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sri Lanka**, **Sri Lanka Design Week**, and **Urban Island**; promotes sustainable craft ecosystems (Garments Without Guilt initiative referenced).
  - **Lin Gong-Deutschmann** — Managing Director, **AOD & Design corp group**; oversees operations and emphasizes industry–craft collaboration and youth empowerment.
  - **Prof. Robert Meeder** — CEO since September 2019; leads efforts to establish a South Asian knowledge hub in design and innovation; background in luxury fashion, sustainability, and design education; focuses on industry–university linkages.

- **Partnerships and programs**
  - **Northumbria University** partnership — enables 100% UK-degree pathways in **Colombo** for BA (Hons) Design programs (fashion & textile design; fashion marketing & design; graphic design; motion graphics & animation; interior design).
  - **De Montfort University (DMU)** partnership — postgraduate **MA Design Innovation** and **MA Design Management and Entrepreneurship**; includes Contour Fashion Innovation MA.
  - **AOD Graduate School** — offers MA programs (e.g., MA Design Innovation; MA Design Management and Entrepreneurship) aimed at producing dynamic innovators and entrepreneurs.
  - **Colombo Innovation Tower** — hosts AOD’s campus and serves as a catalyst space for collaboration among businesses, researchers, and students.

  - Initiatives: **Sri Lanka Design Festival**, **Island Craft Project**, **Urban Island**, and **FashionMarket.lk**; advance Sri Lanka’s design profile and integrate local crafts with international design education.

  - Delivers UK-degree programs in Sri Lanka through AOD, with students enrolled as Northumbria University students.
  - Degree certificates identical to UK peers; eligible to graduate in the UK or Colombo.
  - 100% international faculty; moderation by Northumbria’s examination board; access to Northumbria international resources.
  - Strong industry links with built-in internships; graduate employment programme reported at 100% success for the last 7 years.
  - Recognized by the University Grants Commission Sri Lanka (UGC).

  - **Northumbria University** partnership — enables 100% UK-degree pathways in **Colombo** for BA (Hons) Design programs (fashion & textile design; fashion marketing & design; graphic design; motion graphics & animation; interior design).

  - **AOD Graduate School** — offers MA programs (e.g., MA Design Innovation; MA Design Management and Entrepreneurship) aimed at producing dynamic innovators and entrepreneurs.
  - **Colombo Innovation Tower** — hosts AOD’s campus and serves as a catalyst space for collaboration among businesses, researchers, and students.

  - Delivers UK-degree programs in Sri Lanka through AOD, with students enrolled as Northumbria University students.

  - 100% international faculty; moderation by Northumbria’s examination board; access to Northumbria international resources.
  - Strong industry links with built-in internships; graduate employment programme reported at 100% success for the last 7 years.

- Programs and delivery
  - Full-time BA (Hons) programmes across fashion, textiles, interior design, visual communication, motion graphics, animation, film/TV, 3D product design; foundations and diploma options; masters available.
  - E-learning options: three categories of online learning (online, offline, blended) with a university-backed learning portal and international faculty.

- Revenue streams
  - Tuition/degree fees aligned to Northumbria-based programs (local and international cohorts).
  - Application fees: LKRs 5,000 for Sri Lankan students; GBP 33 for international students.
  - Industry internships as part of the program adding contextual value (indirect revenue via partnerships and enhanced student outcomes).
